pages.title: Temporal Accelerator
pages.text: The <item>Temporal Accelerator/$ is a machine that speeds up time in a 5x5x5 area. It can affect blocks, entities, or both. It consumes a <thing>$(l:beam/time)time beam/$ and produces <thing>$(l:intro/technomancy)temporal entropy/$ as a byproduct.$(br2)While holding a <item>$(l:essentials/wrench)wrench/$, the affected 5x5x5 area will be highlighted. Right-clicking

the <item>temporal accelerator/$ will rotate it, and shift-right-clicking will change the mode between affecting only entities, only blocks, or both.$(br2)The <item>temporal accelerator/$ accepts a <thing>$(l:beam/time)time beam/$ in the back. It will speed up time in the affected area by (<thing>$(l:intro/beam)beam power/$)/4 extra ticks per tick (or (<thing>$(l:intro/beam)beam power/$)*25%). While boosting time, <thing>$(l:intro/technomancy)temporal entropy

<thing>$(l:intro/technomancy)/$ is produced- the amount produced grows exponentially with the applied boost- producing (2^(extra ticks))/2 <thing>$(l:intro/technomancy)temporal entropy/$ per tick (aka: +100% boost is 1TEn/tick, +200% boost is 2TEn/tick, +300% is 4TEn/tick, etc.).$(br2)Multiple overlapping <item>temporal accelerators/$ stack additively.$(br2)
